title: RACE TRACK overview page
user_story:
As a visitor
I want to see a list of all RACE TRACKS
So I can get a general idea of the different types that exist
And by scrolling through them find interesting ones
description:
* There is a dedicated page (with a dedicated URL) where all RACE TRACKS are presented.
* A warning message is shown when there are no RACE TRACKS.
* The overview page always returns with status code \`200\`, no matter if any RACE TRACK exists or not.
* By default, the RACE TRACKS are sorted \`ascending\` by their \`name\`.
* The sorting is always case-insensitive.
* Each RACE TRACK is presented with its primary information and a link to its detail page.
* The overview displays at most 100 RACE TRACKS at once.
* When there are more than 100 RACE TRACKS then the \`pagination\` feature is activated.
* Pagination allows the user to scroll through all RACE TRACKS - 100 items at a time.
* The user is able to bookmark and revisit any paginated RACE TRACK page.
